about.description:
A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to
run simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
in an easily processable form.

about.summary: A Python interface to the 6S Radiative Transfer Model

name: py6s
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "Py6S" %}
{% set version = "1.7.0" %}
{% set sha256 = "e16cc28e54a59d3908b3902744d261046630e6811cb50b6a13e746f68d421b8b" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - pysolar 0.6
    - matplotlib
    - scipy
    - numpy
    - sixs

test:
  imports:
    - Py6S
    - Py6S.Params
    - Py6S.SixSHelpers

about:
  home: http://py6s.rtwilson.com/
  license: LGPL-3.0
  license_family: LGPL

  summary: A Python interface to the 6S Radiative Transfer Model

  description: |
    A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to
    run simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
    in an easily processable form.

  doc_url: http://py6s.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
  dev_url: https://github.com/robintw/py6s

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - robintw

about.description:
A wrapper for the 6S Radiative Transfer Model to make it easy to
run simulations with a variety of input parameters, and to produce outputs
in an easily processable form.
about.summary: A Python interface to the 6S Radiative Transfer Model
